segment.source: How to Add or Remove URL Redirection Information in a Deployed MED-V Workspace
segment.target: How to Add or Remove URL Redirection Information in a Deployed MED-V Workspace

segment.source: How to Add or Remove URL Redirection Information in a Deployed MED-V Workspace
segment.target: How to Add or Remove URL Redirection Information in a Deployed MED-V Workspace

segment.source: How to Add or Remove URL Redirection Information in a Deployed MED-V Workspace
segment.target: How to Add or Remove URL Redirection Information in a Deployed MED-V Workspace

segment.source: To edit URL redirection information in a deployed MED-V workspace, we recommend that you update the system registry by using Group Policy.
segment.target: To edit URL redirection information in a deployed MED-V workspace, we recommend that you update the system registry by using Group Policy.

segment.source: Although we do not recommend it, you can also rebuild and redeploy the MED-V workspace with the updated URL redirection information.
segment.target: Although we do not recommend it, you can also rebuild and redeploy the MED-V workspace with the updated URL redirection information.

segment.source: The registry key is usually located at:
segment.target: The registry key is usually located at:

segment.source: ComputerHKEYLOCALMACHINESOFTWAREMicrosoftMEDVv2UserExperience
segment.target: ComputerHKEYLOCALMACHINESOFTWAREMicrosoftMEDVv2UserExperience

segment.source: The following multi-string value must be present:
segment.target: The following multi-string value must be present:

segment.source: The value data for is a list of all of the URLs that you specified for redirection when you built the MED-V workspace package by using the MED-V Workspace Packager.
segment.target: The value data for is a list of all of the URLs that you specified for redirection when you built the MED-V workspace package by using the MED-V Workspace Packager.

segment.source: For more information, see Create a MED-V Workspace Package.
segment.target: For more information, see Create a MED-V Workspace Package.

segment.source: You can add and remove URL redirection information by performing one of the following tasks:
segment.target: You can add and remove URL redirection information by performing one of the following tasks:

segment.source: Edit the URL Redirection Registry Key and Deploy Using Group Policy
segment.target: Edit the URL Redirection Registry Key and Deploy Using Group Policy

segment.source: Edit the URL Redirection Text File and Rebuild the MED-V Workspace
segment.target: Edit the URL Redirection Text File and Rebuild the MED-V Workspace

segment.source: To update URL Redirection information by using Group Policy
segment.target: To update URL Redirection information by using Group Policy

segment.source: Edit the registry key multi-string value that is named .
segment.target: Edit the registry key multi-string value that is named .

segment.source: This value is typically located at:
segment.target: This value is typically located at:

segment.source: ComputerHKEYLOCALMACHINESOFTWAREMicrosoftMEDVv2UserExperience
segment.target: ComputerHKEYLOCALMACHINESOFTWAREMicrosoftMEDVv2UserExperience

segment.source: If you are adding URLs to the registry key, enter them one per line, as was required when you built the MED-V workspace package.
segment.target: If you are adding URLs to the registry key, enter them one per line, as was required when you built the MED-V workspace package.

segment.source: For more information, see Create a MED-V Workspace Package.
segment.target: For more information, see Create a MED-V Workspace Package.

segment.source: Deploy the updated registry key by using Group Policy.
segment.target: Deploy the updated registry key by using Group Policy.

segment.source: For more information about how to use Group Policy, see Group Policy Software Installation (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=195931).
segment.target: For more information about how to use Group Policy, see Group Policy Software Installation (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=195931).

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: This method of editing URL redirection information is a MED-V best practice.
segment.target: This method of editing URL redirection information is a MED-V best practice.

segment.source: To rebuild the MED-V workspace by using an updated URL text file
segment.target: To rebuild the MED-V workspace by using an updated URL text file

segment.source: Another method of adding and removing URLs from the redirection list is to update the URL redirection text file and then use it to build a new MED-V workspace.
segment.target: Another method of adding and removing URLs from the redirection list is to update the URL redirection text file and then use it to build a new MED-V workspace.

segment.source: You can then redeploy the MED-V workspace as before, by using your standard process of deployment, such as an ESD system.
segment.target: You can then redeploy the MED-V workspace as before, by using your standard process of deployment, such as an ESD system.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: We do not recommend this method of editing URL redirection information.
segment.target: We do not recommend this method of editing URL redirection information.

segment.source: In addition, any time that you redeploy the MED-V workspace back out to your enterprise, first time setup must run again, and any data saved in the virtual machine is lost.
segment.target: In addition, any time that you redeploy the MED-V workspace back out to your enterprise, first time setup must run again, and any data saved in the virtual machine is lost.
